csv

Class CSVHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • csv.CSVHandler

  • public final class CSVHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the reading and writing of relevant csv files. The csv are of three different formats: item properties, sales logs, and manifests Attempting to read a csv file of the wrong format will result in an exception.
    Author:
    alfhj

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      static Manifest readManifest(java.io.File file)
      Makes a Manifest from a manifest csv file.

      Writes a String to a file by using FileWriter.

    • Method Detail

      • readCSV

        public static java.lang.String readCSV(java.io.File file)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a file using BufferedReader and returns the contents as a String. It converts the newlines to "\n"
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be read
        Returns:
        the file's content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeCSV

        public static void writeCSV(java.io.File file,
                            java.lang.String output)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a String to a file by using FileWriter. If the file's extension is not ".csv", it adds this extension to the end of the filename.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be written to
        output - the String to be written to the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readItemProperties

        public static Stock readItemProperties(java.io.File file)
                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                       CSVFormatException,
                                       StockException
        Reads an item property csv file and returns the Stock containing Item objects corresponding to these items. The amounts are set to 0.
        Parameters:
        file - the item property csv file
        Returns:
        the Stock containing the Item
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        CSVFormatException - if the csv file is not a item property file
        StockException - via Item and Stock

      • readSalesLog

        public static Stock readSalesLog(java.io.File file)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 CSVFormatException,
                                 StockException,
                                 StoreException
        Read a sales log file and returns a Stock containing these items with their amounts. The Item object corresponding to the string in the csv file is found by searching in the store's inventory using Stock.searchItem(string). This means that the store's inventory is used as a database for possible items.
        Parameters:
        file - the sales log csv file
        Returns:
        the Stock containing the sales log items and amounts
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        CSVFormatException - if the csv file is not a item sales log file
        StockException - via Stock
        StoreException - if item string is not found in store's inventory

      • readManifest

        public static Manifest readManifest(java.io.File file)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    CSVFormatException,
                                    DeliveryException,
                                    StockException,
                                    StoreException
        Makes a Manifest from a manifest csv file. Like readSalesLog, also uses the store's inventory to look up items.
        Parameters:
        file - the manifest csv file to be read
        Returns:
        the Manifest with the relevant trucks and their cargo
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        CSVFormatException - if the csv file is not a valid manifest file
        DeliveryException - via Truck
        StockException - via Stock
        StoreException - if item string is not found in store's inventory

      • writeManifest

        public static void writeManifest(java.io.File file,
                                 Manifest manifest)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a given Manifest to a manifest csv file.
        Parameters:
        file - the csv file to be written to
        manifest - the Manifest object to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
